task_summary: Robot arm moves to reach a towel on a mat using sequential perception and approach, verifying final position.

task_long_description.overview: This episode shows a robotic arm tasked with reaching a towel placed flat on a surface. The arm begins above the workspace, visually locates the towel, approaches above it, aligns, and moves to make contact, stopping when it confirms proximity. The sequence demonstrates robust perception and cautious motion planning. Constraints are workspace area and precise positioning by the arm; no physical grasp is attempted.
preconditions: Towel is placed on accessible mat within workspace
Robot arm is powered on and homed
No obstructions between arm and towel
stepwise_plan: Check if towel is visible; re-acquire if not
Move above the towel at a safe offset
Approach and align with the towel
Verify arrival at the towel location
success_criteria: Gripper is positioned above and then at the towel
All motion steps are completed in sequence
failure_and_recovery: If towel is not visible, scan up to 3 times
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates when IsAt(towel) succeeds, indicating the end-effector has reached the towel.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the towel is visible to sensors
Performs raster scan to find the towel
Detects position and orientation of the towel
Moves the robot's gripper above the towel
Approaches and aligns the gripper with the towel
Checks if the robot gripper is at the towel's position

failure_modes: Scan fails to localize towel after retries
Approach fails due to occlusion or out-of-reach
IsAt condition not satisfied due to positioning error
recovery_strategy: Perform ScanForTarget (max 3 attempts) if towel is not visible
Sequence aborts if any step fails; manual intervention required
assumptions: Instruction is 'Reach a towel.' but grasp is NOT attempted.
Frames show only arm reaching, not grasping or manipulating towel.
Towel object is uniquely identified from the visual scene.
No occlusions or hidden object states in the episode.

expected_success_criteria: Robot end-effector arrives at the position of the towel.
